title: Computer Science Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed. My interviewer was an instructor at the School of Computing and it was a remote computer science intern position with a company the school is partnered with.
Interview Questions: Have you ever used C#?

title: South Guide (Tour Guide) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Very nice, was very professional. It was a great process for an on campus job. The people are nice and amazing and it is a great. I really enjoyed interviewing with them and learning some more about the office itself
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was like any other interview. They asked why I wanted to join their team. I told them. They asked what I wanted from the job, etc. As long as you got the skills, you'll get the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: online and in person. It was a great experience and I am happy with how I went. the company in general is great. The staff asked great questions that I was able to answer
Interview Questions: why do you want this position

title: Occupational Therapy Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Alabama in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very organized, but slightly too formal making it an overwhelming experience. They questions were detailed and slightly different than any other place I interviewed. You will interview with two people, on the second floor of the allied health building.
Interview Questions: Q: What made you want to become an occupational therapist?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Alabama in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Phone and in-person interview. Typical interview questions. 30 min long with manager and senior manager. Nothing out of the ordinary. Very fast follow up process and contacted me within a week to get a background check done and started a week afterwards.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of South Alabama
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy online application, but it took a forever long time to hear back from HR.  Once I did hear back, I interviewed quickly and was on boarded quickly as well.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my previous experience working with patients.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Alabama in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked basics about computers and MS office. HTML. How are you with customer support. Willing to work university faculty. Willing to lift computers and work with computer hardware and software.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience with MS office

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very relaxed and somewhat mimicked a group discussion. I was interviewed, jointly, by 4 women. The Interim Director was in attendance as well. They made me feel comfortable which helped ease my nerves. The interview process was short and they notified me immediately that I had an offer.
Interview Questions:
How I would handle assisting multiple employees? 
Describe how I would prioritize tasks

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of South Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Standard three employee interview where they sat around the table and asked the person questions. The interview wasn't bad. Not something that you can really review for. The type of interview where you should know the answers to the questions. Basically, common sense.
Interview Questions: What does integrity mean to you?

title: New Student Recruitment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a panel of 6 people and 6 more on the phone for my first interview. Was required to give a presentation at the end like I was presenting to high school students.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years

title: Police Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first by Human resources, Then by the Chief of USA police Dept. The Chief reviewed my training records and reviewed my past as well as the first interview and if I met Alabama APOST standards.
Interview Questions: Training, years of experience , certifications, why you left your last Department.

title: Degree Analysis Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of the Admissions director, and assistant director. We spoke in her office, very casual.  They asked several questions about my previous work background.  Since I worked for several colleges, and universities before I already had a bit of insight of what to expect.  The interview process has since changed, and is now performed by a committee, whom later gets together and discusses candidates.
Interview Questions: I always find it difficult when they ask me, where I will be in five years?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: They called me in, asked about my experience and how I can be an asset to the student center. After I answered the question they offered me the job. The entire process was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: What are my greatest strengths

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First, I filled out an online application. Then I got a phone call from HR, and they asked me to come in for an interview. At the meeting with HR, they explained the benefits and went over my online application. They didn't really ask me any questions. Then if they think you qualify, they forward you application to the department (they did with me). Then the department called me for an interview. 
I interviewed with the director, who would have been my supervisor, and then with the VP.
After I interviewed with the department people, they took about 2 weeks to make a decision.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
How does this position relate to your studies?
Why do you want this job?
Why the University of South Alabama?

title: Web Design Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at University of South Alabama
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took about a year because the university went on a hiring freeze immediately after my first interview.  The interview was not challenging, mostly me talking about my experience. Intially interviewed with HR and then passed to the department hiring.
Interview Questions: most of the questions were behavioral so look at behavioral interview questions and be able to sell yourself and your resume.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly simple and did not require a lot of work. I enjoyed my time there and my interviewer was a nice person. It was also completely straightforward and simple.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't an actual interview process.  This was just a position to help a professor to finish up certain projects that needed to be completed.  My interview was basically another student explaining to the professor that I wanted to help assist with any work that they needed assistance with.
Interview Questions: How many hours would you be willing to work?

title: Secretary IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of South Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Typing test and interview with human resources following by referral to department for interview with immediate supervisor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Alabama in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just applied online and got a call from the head coach. He asked me some pretty straight forward process. I had little experience but he just wanted to know that I was a reliable hard working person. Made sure I could handle the workload and let me know coaching is more than justbeing out there with the athletes.
Interview Questions: How are you on the operations side of things?

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of South Alabama (Mobile, AL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: A very friendly environment, with better than expected benefits.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, only honest ones.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of South Alabama in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied for my position and was contacted within a week by Human Resources.  I spoke on the phone with the person I would be working for and an interview was set up.  I was notified shortly after the interview and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself
